subject: Simsonn Plus X Pedal ISSUES
description_text:
Hi. I am having some major issues with my set of pedals. I purchased them
on amazon from your storefront there.

Here is what is happening and some stuff I've done to try and trouble shoot
it.

I have a Simmagic Alpha Evo 12nm Wheelbase, The Simsonn Plus X Pedals from
you, and a Next level racing lite 2.0


On the pedal software, my throttle seems fine and detects input, but my
brake absolutely does not. It's either on 100% full force in the software
without me touching it, or when I go to offset and click it, it goes back
to 0 and wont move no matter how hard I press it. However when I DO press
it, the force registers from 0.00kg to 0.4kg or something so it DOES seem
to detect it but not in its full and capable way. If I go to calibrate, the
numbers for all 3 pedals are constantly moving without any input. The
number will again go up when I press the brake, but very very slightly and
it doesn't register on the sliding scale bar.

I have tried quite a few trouble shooting steps and additional purchases to
no avail. I have tried a shielded USB cable,a USB Isolator.  a powered USB
Hub, Grounding the simson control box to the brake pedal/rig and none of
these options helped me at all.

I truly thought it was EMI issues from my wheelbase, but I completely
unplugged the connections to the wheelbase and unplugged the power to it
from my outlet and the issues from the pedals still persist so I'm pretty
confident with that completely unplugged, it is not the wheelbase issues.

Any help would be GREATLY appreciated because I truly am at my wits end
trying to get these to work so I can continue racing

Thank you

- Tim

conversations.body_text: Hi Tim Lewis,    Could you please provide a photo of the brake sensor from the front so I can check whether there is any installation error? The brake pressure sensor must not be in contact with or blocked by anything during operation. From your description, it seems that the wall, bracket, or control box might be interfering with the sensorâ€™s movement, which could prevent it from outputting data correctly. You may also try removing the brake pedal and testing the pressure data separately to rule out installation issues.  Additionally, please note that all three sensors are high-precision pressure sensors. Minor fluctuations in the single, tens, or even hundreds digits are normal and will not affect gameplay. To avoid any possible interference, you can also configure about a 5% dead zone in the software. Another option is to connect the green ground wire between the brake and the main control box. Please ensure proper metal-to-metal contact, as paint on the surface may affect grounding effectiveness.
